article.headline: Kennesaw State 69, Clark Atlanta 62
article.story: KENNESAW, Ga. (AP) -- Ryan Daugherty scored five of his 15 points during a 14-0 second-half run that enabled Kennesaw State to overcome a 2-point deficit in a 69-62 victory over Clark Atlanta on Saturday night. The Panthers (2-3) led 40-38 when Daugherty got on a roll. Ronell Wooten, who had 12 points, gave the Owls (2-5) their biggest lead of the game when he slammed in an alley-oop dunk for a 56-42 advantage with 8:30 remaining. Clark Atlanta closed to within six points several times, but that was as close as it got. Shuan Steagall led Kennesaw with 17 points. Jon-Michael Nickerson and Tanner Jacobs each added 10 for the Owls. Kevin Johnson scored 25 points, hitting 7 of 13 from 3-point range, to lead the Panthers and Ale Burt adeed 15 points and 13 rebounds.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
